RoleResponsibility: This role belongs to the Marketing/Sales Effectiveness Practice which is to identify the optimal path to improve effectiveness of clients' marketing (or sales) strategy/activities via advanced analytical solutions.   The mission of this role is to help our clients identify their business opportunities or solve their business issues, by proposing optimal analytical solutions and delivering the analysis with actionable business insights, based on deep understanding of client needs and robust analytical expertise across varied Nielsen solutions. Once a project is commissioned, the individual in this role will collaborate with internal modeling hub on most solutions, translating client needs into detailed analytical requirements for the modeling hub, and drawing/reporting actionable business insights out of the modeling/analytics outcome to meet clients' business needs. Through this, this role will build client satisfactions, leading to sustainable revenue for Nielsen.   To achieve this mission, the individual will be responsible for:   Accountable for leading analysis projects on assigned Marketing/Sales Effectiveness solutions and ensure the assigned study deliverables meet client needs with actionable insights in a timely manner, as well as company's quality standards, under a supervision of a manager.   Analytical mastery of assigned Marketing (or Sales) Effectiveness solutions, and technical mastery by collaborating with internal solution experts/modeling hub. Translate client needs into study design and detailed analytical requirements, for flawless briefing to the modeling hub. Gather necessary data for analysis from clients or other internal departments in Nielsen, and review quality of the data, to feed the modeling hub. Guide the modeling hub to ensure timely modeling execution following Nielsen quality standards. Interpret modeling outcomes from the hub with actionable business insights to fully meet client needs and company's quality standards. Assist in the analysis and report development for clients, including charting. Assist in answering inquiries from clients on the analysis of outcomes. Support senior members of the team in proposal development, including detailed solution specs finalization, collaborating with internal solution experts, and preparation for proposal presentations. Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility.
Requirements: BA/BS in numerate discipline required. Robust logical/analytical thinking. Strong Problem-solving capability, sometimes through out-of-box thinking. Excellent communication skills, can articulate concepts simply and concisely to the point. Strong mindset on accountability, results oriented; one who takes initiatives & follow-through. Robust statistical knowledge. Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills. Able to convert ideas into powerful visualizations & charts.

RoleResponsibility: About Barclays Barclays is a transatlantic consumer, corporate and investment bank offering products and services across personal, corporate and investment banking, credit cards and wealth management, with a strong presence in our two home markets of the UK and the US. Our goal is to become the bank of choice by providing superior services to customers and clients and supporting our stakeholders via a commercially successful business that generates long-term sustainable returns. Our two clearly defined divisions, Barclays UK and Barclays International, provide diversification by business line, geography and customer, enhancing financial resilience and helping to contribute to the delivery of consistent returns through the business cycle. We have a strong core business with exciting prospects, well positioned to deliver long-term value for our shareholders. Consistent with the objective of delivering long-term sustainable value for all our stakeholders, we have developed our Shared Growth Ambition äóñ our approach to citizenship and the sustainability of the business model we operate. The aim is to make decisions and do business that provides our clients and customers, and the communities which we serve, with access to a prosperous future. The delivery of our strategy is underpinned by the energy, commitment and passion of our people, and we are clear on our common purpose: to help people achieve their ambitions, in the right way. About [insert Business Area name] The key purpose of this role is to support the Risk Manager in the delivery of the Risk Agenda across the region, managing and reporting on premises risks, in addition to providing support, development and direction of Risk and Governance across property portfolio & Business units. It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. Key Accountabilities Premises Controls Management  Ensure that the governance of the Premises Risk and Control profile across all Barclays key risk data sets (such as ORAC, ATT, BCIT) is pro-actively managed through the creation and active monitoring of risk and control data points as required. Ensure full compliance to the Barclays Control Framwork through oversight of all governance requirements for Risk Issues, Risk Events, Dispensation/Waiver/Breaches, Controls and maintenance of all Premises related Policies and Standards. Maintain the Premises Risk key indicator suite and provision of reports for the Key Risk Assessment Summary/Controls Maturity Process. Support in the co-ordination of Premises risk governance committees/forums by providing succinct reports, actions plans and statistics to an agreed format. Directly support the Premises Controls Leads in their day to day interaction covering any control related governance activities. Focus on the ongoing development of processes, tools and ways of working to ensure that the Premises Controls team remains efficient and in line with any strategic initiatives from central teams such as CGI or the CCO. Be able to support related project delivery by ensuring appropriate personal knowledge development associated with operational risk, methodologies and practices. Conduct regular deep-dive and thematic reviews on the Controls premises risk profile to understand trends, opportunities, gaps and focus areas to help provide insight for the Premises Controls prioritisation agenda. Support periodic reviews and refreshes of any of the Premises relevant policies and standards  Design and produce any relevant reports and analysis in support of management oversight of the controls profile and provide forward looking analysis of upcoming governance related priorities Risk and Control Objective Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.

RoleResponsibility: About the Institute of High Performance ComputingŒæ(IHPC) A*STARäó»s Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) was established in April 1998 to provide leadership in high performance computing as a strategic resource for scientific inquiry and industry development. It seeks to power discoveries through advanced methodologies, techniques and new tools in modelling, simulation and visualisation. Its core research areas are in the realm of complex-coupled systems, mechanics and fluid dynamics, large-scale systems, digital modelling, adaptive and collaborative computing, data mining and analysis, computational electronics and electromagnetics, computational materials science and chemistry.Œæ For more information about IHPC, please visit www.ihpc.a-star.edu.sgŒæ Job Description Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) is looking for candidates with the talent and passion to pursue first class research in modelling and simulation. You will be expected to conduct innovative research, design and develop cutting edge models and algorithms for analysing multi-process/source and heterogeneous data from advanced manufacturing science and engineering domains. You will also be expected to work closely with the researchers from IHPC as well as other A*STAR institutes to drive the development of prognostics and optimization modelling capabilities for predictive maintenance. The successful candidates will have the opportunities to collaborate with researchers and practitioners from other A*STAR institutes, as well as industry partners to translate the developed solutions for tackling real world modelling and simulation problems confronted today and in near future.
Requirements: PhD degree in Computer Science/Engineering or other related fields. Experience in analyzing data of different variety would be an advantage. Programming experience in Python, Matlab, R, C++, Java, etc. Able to work in a collaborative environment. Able to communicate well with colleagues and collaborators Experience in database management and web-based development is a plus Fast learner with abilit Œæto multi-task 1 to 3 years of work experience  To apply, you should demonstrate in your CV the following essential skills:  Ability to develop computational models Ability to perform analysis in Python.

RoleResponsibility: AWS Infrastructure Planning and Sourcing (IPS) is searching for a bright and ambitious individual to join our team as a Supply Chain Manager (SCM). The role will be responsible financial controller ship including execution of tasks associated with securing approval for spend (new PO and tracking spend against Blanket POs), work with owners of capital budgets to assist in securing Capital Asset Requests. The role audits purchases, purchase requisition (PR) / purchase order (PO) generation and management, vendor sourcing and competitive bidding and is a member of Infrastructure Planning and Sourcing (IPS) team.  This position will partner with the IScAP leadership team in the development of capital and operational budget planning, including the submittal and management of contract requests from our technical and operational teams. Additionally, this role will work with these teams in the vetting and engagement of both new and existing vendors and will be point of contact for PR submission and PO management. The SCM will have ownership over daily maintenance and follow-up on new and open contract and/or PR tickets to ensure that purchasing and contract requests are tracking to completion. The SCM will assist in vetting and creating scopes of work, which are a key component of work orders. The SCM will provide procurement coverage for all aspects of regional operations; ranging from preventative maintenance and emergency response PRäó»s to planning/purchasing of equipment spares to general office supplies. The SCM must have to ability to clearly communicate and explain complex demand/supply forecasts (inputs, outputs, rationale, gaps) and recommendations to senior management. The SCM will need to understand the technical requirements of our partners and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of procurement activities. The SCM will also monitor inventory levels to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained to support build and repair activities. They will ensure appropriate inventory levels are maintained and make inventory movement/transfer decisions for various Data centers. They will also evaluate potential restocking or purchasing requirements with the Data Center Operations Manager to ensure our operational strategies are met. The scope includes to have all shipments in compliance with local country regulations, ensure right classification and description for new items and interface with internal Import/Export teams. The SCM should be aware of and comply with Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and along with local country laws/regulations at all times while discharging his/her duties. This role will have a strong focus on continuous improvement, developing/tracking key performance indicators and the successful candidate will have a proven track record developing models, tools and processes to increase the overall supply chain effectiveness, reliability, responsiveness and costs efficiency, achieved through process improvements and streamlining procedures/workflows.  The ideal candidate will have experience working in a high volume, warehouse or distribution environment, as well as experience and knowledge of reverse logistics processes. Candidates must have advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel be comfortable working with Microsoft Office products.  The ideal candidate is a self-starter, possesses strong verbal and written communication skills, and has strong attention to detail. You must be able to work independently and generate high-quality work products in an ambiguous environment. You must have a professional demeanor and be able to communicate appropriately with people at every level, from technicians to upper management. Operating in a and sometimes ambiguous environment you will be required to work autonomously taking full control and responsibility for achieving business objectives. This role provides a real opportunity to develop original ideas, approaches, and solutions in a competitive and ever changing business climate.
Requirements: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  Bacheloräó»s degree, preferably in procurement supply chain from a reputed University. 4 to 7 years in procurement / supply chain with demonstrated knowledge of Inventory Planning management, end to end contract administration and Vendor management from sourcing to performance. Experience in change management and process improvement. Ability to translate large amounts of data into useful information and draw conclusions. Maintain key operational metrics that measure supply chain performance driving continuous improvement. Ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to overcome obstacles and deliver results. 5+ yearsäó» experience with Microsoft office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, Access) Exceptional analytics, judgment, and communication skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences. Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Experience in infrastructure operations would be an advantage, but is not essential. Experience in mechanical and electrical facility management would be an advantage, but is not essential. Experience implementing continuous improvement methodologies and programs such as Lean, Six Sigma, DMAIC and Change Management. Experience in project management and a strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional projects would be an advantage.

RoleResponsibility: Our Team Our outstanding marketing team provides a strategic infrastructure that supports all elements of the Informatica business and is specifically focused on supporting our sales team with the information, insights and materials they need to exceed their goals. Œæ Your Opportunity Reporting directly to the Senior Director Marketing, APJ and aligned to the Country Managers, you will focus on planning and executing field marketing programs that drive pipeline generation and conversion to support revenue goals.Œæ You will also have responsibility to support corporate marketing to ensure the programs they run in/for APJ are aligned to the business needs, especially the sales strategy and objectives. Œæ Our Ideal Candidate The right candidate has proven success in field and digital marketing äóñ with strong execution experience and emphasis on digital marketing, high touch, public relations, social marketing & selling äóñ a passion for technology, and an entrepreneurial spirit that enables the professional to work relatively independently.Œæ  Essentially, we are seeking a high-energy, results-oriented marketer to play an integral role in expanding our customer advocacy practices. You're committed to establishing and maintaining customer satisfaction and possess a variety of tools to get the job done. Our generous benefits vary depending on your geographic work location. JobTitle: GIS - Postdoctoral Fellow (Algorithms for Long Read Transcript Quantification)
RoleResponsibility: Œæ Long read sequencing has the promise to overcome some of the key limitations of short read sequencing technologies. Amongst others, long read sequencing allows the quantification of full length transcripts and enables direct RNA sequencing without amplification. As the technology is still in an early phase, there are only few algorithms available to study long read transcriptomics data. The group of Jonathan Gí_ke is searching for a postdoctoral fellow to develop algorithms for high throughput, long read transcriptomics data, and to lead a project on transcriptional diversity in cancer.

RoleResponsibility: The Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering at NUS invites applications for 1 postdoctoral research position to work on this project. The main focus of this research project is to develop Bayesian learning methods to tackle "MUSIC" geotechnical data. The practical impact is that engineers can estimate design properties from the full suite of geotechnical tests routinely conducted in practice, thus deriving full value for the investment. In short, the characteristics of geotechnical data, which can vary in space and time, can be succinctly described as MUSIC äóñ Multivariate, Uncertain and unique, Sparse, and InComplete.
Requirements: PhD in Civil Engineering or equivalent Deep knowledge of Bayesian methods Proven track record in writing computer codes Good analytical ability and conceptual thinking

RoleResponsibility: JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  Evaluates manufacturing processes by designing and conducting research programs; applying knowledge of product design, fabrication, assembly, tooling, and materials; conferring with equipment vendors; soliciting observations from operators. Develops manufacturing processes by studying product requirements; researching, designing, modifying, and testing manufacturing methods and equipment; conferring with equipment vendors. Improves manufacturing efficiency by analyzing and planning work flow, space requirements, and equipment layout. Assures product and process quality by designing testing methods; testing finished- product and process capabilities; establishing standards; confirming manufacturing processes. Provides manufacturing decision-making information by calculating production, labor, and material costs; reviewing production schedules; estimating future requirements. Prepares product and process reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends. Provides manufacturing engineering information by answering questions and requests. Maintains product and company reputation by complying with government regulations. Keeps equipment operational by coordinating maintenance and repair services; following manufacturer's instructions and established procedures; requesting special service. Maintains product and process data base by writing computer programs; entering data. Completes design and development projects by training and guiding technicians. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Requirements: JOB REQUIREMENTS  Must possess at least a Diploma in Engineering. Must have at least 3 years of relevant experience Hands-on experience on PFMEA, Manufacturing process know-how and troubleshooting. Six sigma trained preferred. Must be willing to work in Loyang, East side of Singapore. Full-Time position(s) available.  Official Working Schedule: Monday - Friday 8.00am - 5.30pm

RoleResponsibility: The Merchandise Space Planner for Spirit/Wines/Tobacco (SWT) will be responsible for developing and maintaining detailed planograms by store location based on passenger profile by location, SWT strategy and productivity/profitability targets.Œæ The Space Planner will partner with the Global & Regional Merchandizing teams, Planning, Store Operations, Replenishment & Allocations and Visual Merchandizing to drive results through effective planograms and merchandize presentation. Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities The role and responsibilities of this truly cross-functional position will be focused on, but not limited to:  Create, execute and update planograms across Spirits, Wine and Tobacco category in close collaboration with Merchandizing team supporting all stores in the Singapore region Conduct sku/space productivity/profitability reviews and analysis, quickly identifying trends in business and adjust space needs based on sell through/OOS Analyze sales, trends and passengeräó»s data to develop, recommend and execute category specific space merchandising opportunities to maximize floor productivity Work closely with the merchants/planners on range review, sku optimization and rationalization.ŒæŒæ Work closely with operations to maximize density on the floor to drive sales, UPT Develop merchandising standards to ensure all planograms and associated materials, including Visual Merchandizing, are commercially focused, relevant for customers and effective for stores Improve and fine-tune existing processes so to come to a Standard Operational Procedure (SOP) that will support successful implementation of planograms Evolve the merchandising approach over time in line with changing shopper and business needs using trial activity where necessary to verify the approach. Work with Merchandizing and Operations to manage new store openings and renovations Partner with Merchandizing, Store Operations and Store Design to articulate fixture needs and develop new fixture designs to better utilize space and improve product presentation Establish relationships with Store Operations, Replenishment to be a resource for space constraint solutions Maintain product data integrity for all items as it relates to planogram process Position requires manager to be on the sales floor around 60% of the time and in the office 40% of the time, but, must remain flexible based on needs/demands of the business.  Œæ

Company: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
JobTitle: Postdoctoral Associate / Research Associate / Research Scientist (Ref: IRG_FM_2018_011)
RoleResponsibility: Overview The Mobility Management is a new research project introduced in SMART FM Phase 2, which combines behavioural science, emerging transportation technology, and data anlaytics to develop a future urban mobility system for Singapore that integrates public transit, walking and bicycling, shared mobility and autonomous vehicles.Œæ Current phase of the project focuses on demand preference formation and shaping, integrated transit system design, physiological emotional reactions, and social mobility sharing. The project is led by Prof. Jinhua Zhao at MIT. Please see https://mobility.mit.edu/ Œæfor his general research interest. Responsibilities We are seeking a Postdoctoral Associate who will be involved in the behavior mobility management project. The project consists of the following topics: 1) Preference Formation for Autonomous Vehicles; 2) Municipal Level Policy Agenda on New Mobility Service; 3) Autonomous Vehicles-Public Transit System Integration; and 4) Social Mobility Sharing: Dockless Bike and Ridesharing. The specific job scope includes:  Develop stated preference surveys focusing on peopleäó»s attitude towards new transportation technologies, e.g. on-demand shared mobility service, autonomous vehicles; Implement advanced behavioral or econometric modeling methods to study the formation and shaping of preference towards the new transportation technologies; Use simulation or econometric methods to design and to evaluate new public transit systems integrating emerging transportation technologies based on current data from the real world; Develop a full understanding of the interplay among travel behaviors and preference shaping, transport system design and policy, and emerging transportation technologies; Work with team members from SMART and from MIT, regularly report with PIs and publish new findings in journals and/or conferences. Supervise doctoral and master students.
Requirements: PhD degree in Transportation, Computer Science, Mathematics, Applied Physics, Operational Research, Economics, Urban Planning or other relevant disciplines; Skills of transport demand modeling, machine learning, econometric modeling, and/or spatial analysis are expected; Good knowledge of programming e.g. C++, Java, Python, R, SQL etc.; Knowledge in simulation (e.g. agent-based, microsimulation), data mining, and/or GIS; Experience in high-performance computing is a plus; Self-motivated with ability to work both independently and in a team; Good command of written and spoken English.  The project comprises teams from both MIT and SMART in collaboration with several international research and industry partners. This position will be based at the SMART Centre in Singapore. Œæ Interested applicants will have to submit their full CV/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

RoleResponsibility: One Research Fellow position is currently available in the School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, NTU. The job scopes are as follow:  Excellent knowledge in chemical synthesis, optics, photophysics of semiconductors, charge and quasi-particle dynamics, charge transfer mechanisms, femtosecond lasers, and femtosecond laser spectroscopy is essential. Excellent knowledge in the synthesis of halide perovskite materials (including nanostructures) and the fabrication of perovskite solar cells devices.Œæ Excellent knowledge in photonics, photonics microcavities and polaritonic systems is essential. To synthesize, prepare and process perovskite nanomaterials. To operate, optimize, troubleshoot and maintain femtosecond laser systems To setup and align optical beamlines/setups for transient optical spectroscopy experiments.ŒæŒæ To conduct ultrafast optical spectroscopy studies and 2D coherent spectroscopy of novel semiconductors and emergent semiconductor nanostructures. To perform data analysis and data interpretation of transient optical spectroscopy experiments independently To assist the principal investigator with the writing of research papers. To assist the principal investigator in the supervision and mentoring of a small research team comprising of post-graduate students and undergraduate students. Requirements: Candidate must possess at least a BSc 1st Class/2nd Class Upper Honours Degree in Physics or Chemistry or Chemical Sciences. Critical Requirement: Candidate must also have a Minimum 3 Years of Research Experience in the synthesis of halide perovskite materials (including nanostructures); and in processing, fabrication and characterization of organic-inorganic halide perovskite solar cells. Sound chemistry knowledge in the synthesis of perovskite nanomaterials and in the photophysics knowledge in the ultrafast optical spectroscopy field. Experienced in conducting ultrafast optical spectroscopy experiments and data analysis independently. Ability to conceptualize and communicate major elements of experimental design and results to other staffs, managements, and visitors. Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like Labview, Mathematica, Matlab, AutoDesk, Lab Talk, LaTex will be an added advantage.Œæ An effective team player with good communication & interpersonal skills. RoleResponsibility: At Microsoft, our mission is to enable people and businesses throughout the world to realize their full potential. Œæ We are looking for an energetic, passionate and experienced Partner Excellence Manager to join our Singapore based International Operations team.Œæ Œæ The Partner Business Operations team is chartered with helping Microsoft become more proactive and efficient in landing operational change with our managed partners. Œæ This Partner Excellence Manager is a key role and thought leadership partner to the PBO Management Team and should work to deeply understand all aspects of the business to serve as a trusted advisor and become the voice-of-the-partner. Œæ The role will deliver a balance of leading, doing and influencing, in partnership and in close collaboration with the Partner Community Manager, Partner Business Manager and other worldwide Business Operations stakeholders. Œæ The focus of the role is to drive positive outcomes for our partners at scale by accelerating opportunities, identifying and orchestrating the delivery/ execution plans, driving decisions to maximize partner efficiencies and unlocking future strategic opportunities aligned to Move to Modern. The insights of these efforts will set the foundation for developing partner engagement models to drive both external efficiencies and internal target attainment. Responsibilities Œæ Partner Operational Management:   Define, execute and orchestrate Quarterly Strategy to enable Partner Efficiency   Track and manage Partner operational efficiency dashboards   Drive Insights on Partner adoption, Conditions of Success, Operational performance, Partner Move to Modern   Provide data and insight into the strategy and the roadmap for Community & Partner Engagements   Define business insights requirements for Modern Efficiency dashboard   Refine and evolve Partner segmentation based on business priorities and data insights   Voice of the Partner Management (VOB)  Capture and coordinate Regional Voice of the Partner insights Articulate regional partner requirements to drive further partner efficiencies Drive and orchestrate global prioritization & management of feedback loops with corp stakeholders Coordinate partner engagements and execute co-design opportunities Manage, execute and orchestrate partner communication plans to ensure closure of the loop with partners Executing and optimizing the VOB Process with upstream stakeholders to deliver impact to partners Ownership and ongoing management red carpet, change management, ops readiness and training activities  Scorecard Management:   Contribute to the business planning rhythm including preparation for, and participation in, the Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Rhythm-of-the-Business (RoB) activities   Drive PBO scorecard initiative planning for target achievement   Execute initial metric analysis to understand state of the business   Coordinate relevant CoE plans across relevant functions   Drive executive quarterly trending reports   Leverage and provide input into development of reporting capabilities   Partner Lifecycle Management:  Partner with field stakeholders in aligning partner strategies (partner refresh, M2M) Act as trusted advisor for partner performance reviews (PIP) Coordinate ops efficiency targets (RFP) Consolidate optimization opportunities within partner lifecycle management Drive consistency and excellence in how the we engage partners from operational perspective  Change management coordination:  Coordinate submission and intake of projects either regional, global or corp driven impacting partner business management space (OneMap non launch) Provide project management support for PBO coordinating team priorities, resourcing and execution planningŒæ Orchestrate and coordinate PBO execution plans to overall strategies Provide regional feedback to global initiatives and corp driven projects Capture and consolidate centralization opportunities and provide recommendation for activity team activity efficiencies Act as main point of contact for technologies opportunities to optimize team delivery at scale Lead, coordinate and execute process optimization projects . Current example : Channel Contract Management optimization of onboarding, offboarding and partner updates activities.

JobTitle: Project Lead, Network Solution and Delivery
RoleResponsibility: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES and CHALLENGES:  A dynamic individual is required to join the Network Design and Delivery team under Technology Infrastructure department to work on Network Infrastructure project implementation in one of the bank key project, enhancing the bank capability, resiliency and availability in providing service to bankäó»s business. The key challenge is to manage and ensure network project delivery against agreed project plan and timeline aligned with stakeholder requirements in dynamic environment with a high rate of growth and tight timeline.  Report to Network Solution Delivery - Data Lead and manage end to end quality delivery of assigned network project/task for Service migration in one of the bank global data center ensuring adherence to Network engineering standard and project delivery framework Work on circuit migration and be the eyes and hands on the ground for network delivery. Provide consistent and on time planning, tracking and updating of network project related task in coordination with overall project manager. Work throughout the full project life cycle (initiation, build, migration and handover) Resolve issues/risk and dependency of assigned project in coordination with other stakeholders for both technical and non-technical issue Ensures assigned network project/task are delivered on time, on budget against agreed scope Identify, record, work on risk and issues with tracking and reporting aspect Ensure projects solution are in line with approved standard and meets the requirement Escalation point for all matter relating to assigned project in all phases of the project Delivers high quality solutions for the bank on both internal & external connectivity requirements. Take part on interfacing with engineering and stakeholder team to come up with solutions that meets requirement and confirm to standard where possible and alternative when required. Develop influential and trustworthy working relationships with other technology and business peers to achieve performance objectives. This should be aimed at improving team efficiency in performing their work. Value - add to various technology streams by timely and proper engagement and recommending appropriate solutions.  Develops relationships with IT vendors and partners for the benefit of the bank and business.
Requirements: SELECTION CRITERIA:   Preferably possess a valid Expert level certification in Cisco and Juniper product on data and/or security track such as, CCIE or JNCIE certification Strong knowledge in Routing and Switching technology such as BGP, OSPF, VPC, ACI, VXLAN, DMVPN, Multicast, , RSTP, MSTP Strong knowledge in Network Security technology and product such as firewall, proxies, and VPN across different vendors Strong knowledge on load balancer product and technology across multiple product such as F5, Alteon and Netscaller Knowledge in WAN technology such as MPLS, Ethernet WAN, PBB Minimum 10 year practical experience in end to end management and execution of network project infrastructure deployment involving migration of application from one firewall technology to another preferably in banking environment. RoleResponsibility: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisationäó»s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

RoleResponsibility: At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.  The Infrastructure Operations organization is searching for an extraordinary individual with a progressive career history. We are looking for an experienced Training & Documentation Manager to join our Amazon Web Services (AWS) Infrastructure Operations team. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated and be someone who has a proven track record of developing training content and delivering training to others. The position will be based in Singapore and involve managing a team across the APJC region.  We have experienced rapid growth in the demand for a wide range of training courses. To meet these needs the Infrastructure Operations Training team has been tasked with creating blended training programs that support employees working within our Amazon Data Centers, globally.  We have developed and continue to develop technical courses, practical exercises and assessments for our teams who maintain availability and capacity within our data centers. We have adopted a blended approach mixing both instructor led, web based and practical hands on methods of delivery.  The successful candidate will have excellent people management, team building, and writing skills and the ability to translate complex technical content into easy-to-understand training. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have training, instructional design or technical writing experience, and above all must have a passion for learning and developing others.
Requirements: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  High EQ / IQ Technical training management experience Excellent writing skills, and the ability to translate technical content into effective learning solutions. The ability to adapt well to fast-paced environments with changing circumstances, direction, and strategy The ability to conduct training needs assessments on a variety of data center related processes, procedures, tools and critical infrastructure Demonstrated experience of authoring learning tools, learning management system Recent experience in developing job aids, facilitation guides, web based materials and/or other training materials Excellent communication skills for the purpose of knowledge transfer and skill development. Excellent coordination, project management, and organization skills. Strong people management skills  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Previous Data Center experience desired Previous experience in a hyper growth industry Deals well with ambiguity Collaborate with other global resources to ensure regionally developed content is created in accordance with global standards and leveraged accordingly Set global priorities and timelines for the development of new training content and initiatives for teams supporting our critical data center infrastructure Manage resourcing of training projects globally; including delivery and development Support the development and justification of global training budgets and programs Guide a team of highly skilled Subject Matter Experts to understand the training needs and build effective training modules within a wider, set technical curriculum Manage the design and development of training content; including project management where required Partner with other global resources to determine the proper balance between instructor led and web based training opportunities Evaluate the effectiveness of training delivery, post training skills assessments, and practical application exercise Determine opportunities for cross functional training to improve operational effectiveness Manage all testing, assessment data, perform a needs analysis and produce metrics to track progress regionally and ensure global compliance standards are met

JobTitle: SIgN - Research Fellow (Ng Lai Guan's Lab)
RoleResponsibility: The functional Immune Imaging Laboratory in the Singapore Immunology Network (A*STAR) is seeking a post-doctoral fellow to join their team of experienced scientists on a project aimed at understanding myeloid cell development, migration and function. To address our questions, we integrate different cutting-edge approaches, including intravital two-photon microscopy, optical tissue clearing, FACS, Cytof, RNA seq and animal models to investigate myeloid compartmentalization and function. We are specifically interested in recruiting a research fellow with academic background in Life Sciences and relevant experience in immunology, cell biology or intravital imaging. Knowledge of computational approaches for image analysis is also preferred but not required. The candidate should be able to work independently, with the ability to work in a dynamic team of the laboratory. Duties will include:  Animal experimentation and working with human samples Running research projects and conducting experiments, and analyzing data Preparing data for presentation and manuscript submission  For more information about A*STAR and SIgN, please visit www.a-star.edu.sg and https://www.a-star.edu.sg/sign respectively.
Requirements: Ph.D in Life Sciences, Immunology, Molecular Biology or related fields Relevant experience and publications A strong foundation in myeloid cell biology Knowledgeable in cellular / molecular Biology Outstanding oral and written communication skills Good team player, independent, self-driven with good interpersonal skills  We welcome interested applicants to submit a full CV including a list of publications, a letter of motivation addressing the above criteria, and contact details of two referees. The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice.  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Œæ Œæ Œæ

JobTitle: Executive / Senior Executive (Talent Management), PSC Sect
RoleResponsibility: The Public Service Commission (PSC) was constituted in 1951 as an independent organ of state to appoint, promote, transfer, dismiss and exercise disciplinary control over public officers. The PSC Secretariat provides secretariat support to the PSC. This includes formulating conduct and discipline policies, to ensure that officers maintain the highest standards of personal conduct and integrity.ŒæOne significant non-statutory role of the PSC is the award of PSC scholarships for undergraduate and postgraduate studies. The Secretariat assists in the formulation of scholarship policies, talent attraction and development of PSC scholarship holders as potential future leaders in the Public Service. Reporting to the Assistant Director (Talent Management), you will be part of the team to support and facilitate the Public Service Commissionäó»s work in securing and developing top-tier talent through PSC scholarships and maintaining oversight on scholarships throughout the public service. Responsibilities  Develop deep expertise and specialist knowledge in careers in the Singapore Public Service, local and overseas tertiary education landscape, and various HR methodologies for developing top-tier talent. Be a good coach and provide advice to scholarship holders, on their development plans, career paths and assess/monitor their academic progress and participation in CCA, to ensure an all rounded development. Counsel scholarship holders who are not coping well. Manage administrative matters pertaining to scholarship holders' finances, legal agreements, university relations and other forms of sponsorships.Œæ Network with partners such as local and overseas tertiary institutions, as well as engage pre-University students, their parents and teachers. Manage and develop effective and innovative top-tier scholarship administration policies and solutions, and coordinate resources on behalf of other scholarship-awarding agencies on implementation. Provide consulting services to the Ministries on scholarship administration. Oversee, plan and execute high-signature scholarship events/ceremonies and other development programmes for scholarship holders.  Monitor and evaluate competition both from local and overseas sponsoring bodies, market trends, anticipate future challenges and provide inputs to higher management to facilitate long-term planning through key Management Reports. Stay abreast of external practices to recommend leading practices that can be adapted for use in the Civil Service. Build knowledge management and promote sharing of information and best-practices in scholar development methodology and scholarship administration. The ideal candidate will have strong data management and data analyses skills, particularly software packages such as STATA, R and Matlab. Skills in STATA are especially valuable. Responsibilities: The Research Associate assists business school faculty and conducts research, coordinates information management, develops teaching materials, and works on special projects for INSEAD faculty. Potential projects include a range of business and policy-related topics such as: -- Exploring the causal effect of job loss on health -- How to get more women into Tech? Field experiments addressing social identity. -- Designing compensation and organizational systems to enhance productivity. -- Effect of recruitment policies on the selection and retention of employees. -- Exploring how anti-poverty programs affect children and the labor force participation of women. -- How countries diversify their export base and export markets? Some faculty are involved in developing and implementing Randomized Control trials, and the research associate will also be involved in developing and tracking those projects. The position is ideal for a recent university or Masters graduate looking to develop their research skills in economics, management and finance research in view of applying for a PhD program. ŒæIt will provide the candidate with great preparation for PhD programme entry by training the applicant in doing research, giving him/her access to some PhD training and developing a relationship with potential letter writers. The full-time position is for one year, with a possibility of renewal after evaluation at the end of the year.Œæ
Requirements: Requirements:  Bachelor'sŒæ or Masters degree in economics, business, statistics, mathematics, finance, computer science, or engineering preferred. Fluency in written and oral English. Other languages a plus. Previous research experience is a strong plus. Excellent academic record and work ethic required. Excellent organizational and oral/written communication skills required. Enthusiasm for research required. Knowledge of STATA is necessary as well as an interest in learning other relevant computer software and statistics packages (e.g. SAS, R, Mathematica, Matlab, etc).

RoleResponsibility: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisationäó»s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisationäó»s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

RoleResponsibility: Part of a central organization for Back End Manufacturing in Semiconductor Industry that drives and support sister plants Manage and plan the evolution of existing applications and systems used for Back End and Industrial Engineering Provide tools and methods that will be used to improve Industrial Engineering and Back End Manufacturing activity Identify Business Requirements from End Users, Central Organizations and Management Propose solutions and translate Business Requirements for IT developers Coordinate and follow up with IT developers to ensure compliance of requirements and perform user acceptance tests of the deliveries Provide training materials for the end users and conduct training remotely or face to face Audit and drive the Data Quality Ensure the data integrity between systems by design or control Standardize best practices across plants through central referential or guidelines Support end users for application usage, guidance and mass update Drive plant activity and improvement through publishing and monitoring of KPIs and Audits.
Requirements: Degree in Engineering, preferably in Industrial Engineering or equivalent Fresh graduates welcomed or candidates with 3 years or more relevant experience in Industrial engineering Working experience in semiconductor industry is an added advantage Proficient in Microsoft office applications Knowledge of SQL, MS Access, Database management and Qlikview is an added advantage Strong quantitative, analytical and communication skills Good team player and communication skills. Pleasant personality Able to travel

of bid solicitation Evaluate subcontractor bids, aid in pricing alternates, and initiate value engineering alternatives Assist in determining material handling and storage logistics Assist the RoleResponsibility: Full Stack Developer #110808 Credit Suisse Company Overview As one of the world's leading financial services group, Credit Suisse provides its clients with investment banking, private banking and asset management services worldwide.Œæ Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has a long tradition of meeting the complex financial needs of a wide range of clients, offering advisory services, comprehensive solutions and innovative products to companies, institutional clients and high-net-worth private clients globally. The Credit Suisse Group is active in over 50 countries and employs approximately 46,000 people.Œæ Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com. Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com We Offeräó_äó‰äó‰äó‰äó‰äó‰ Department Overview: The APAC Technology and Change organization is responsible for the engineering and support of technology solutions, implementation of change programs, and the associated change, design and data governance for the APAC Division. The organization includes APAC Private Banking (PB) IT and Global Markets (GM) IT. APAC PB IT provides digital capabilities and technology solutions for the APAC Private Banking business, delivering front to back aligned, high quality IT solutions and services to support the growth and profitability of the Bank, ensure compliance, drive efficiency and further reduce complexity and cost. Our Digital Private Bank was launched in Asia in 2015 and has won numerous accolades. We have been awarded the "Best Private Bank äóñ Digital Experience" for the second consecutive year by Asian Private Banker applauding us for being "a true fintech pioneer in the private banking space" and for our attention to client experience and the platform's advanced functionalities. Role Description: A number of new and exciting projects have been initiated within APAC PB IT, enabling you to directly contribute to the success of the business. Naturally, project details are commercially-sensitive but all our projects exhibit the following common features:  Significant engagement with product owners and user-interaction Technical autonomy and innovation Highly motivated and engaged development teams High quality and commercial benefits  As an agile application developer you will work together with business users and members of the development team to provide quality systems that improve productivity, decrease operational risk, enable the business to expand and make users smile. These are high profile applications that offer you the opportunity to shape the future technical direction and take ownership for functional components. Role Responsibility:  Design, develop, test, deploy and support high quality systems. Become a strategic part of the CS business by building positive relationships with all business partners, understanding the challenges they face and using your technical expertise to deliver the systems we need. Collaborate with the Product Owner closely to deliver solutions and to build user-centric banking applications for use by Clients/Relationship Managers/Support functions around the world. Understand the different technology domains within the Bank and how the data across domains is interrelated. Constantly analyze and improve the performance and quality of the product and team. Be willing and able to adapt to changes in priorities and requirements. Remain open and alert to new technology opportunities.
Requirements: You Offeräó_ We have a preference for the following knowledge and experience:  Expertise with Java or any other JVM-based language Expertise with SQL, RDBMS design and optimization Expertise in JavaScript full stack development (e.g. React and Node.js) Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3 Expertise with JUnit, TestNG or any other test framework Strong knowledge of HTTP and (REST) API design Working knowledge of MongoDB or other NoSQL databases  We expect these qualifications and work experience:  Your Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or related discipline is preferred but not required. You have significant work experience in commercial software development, full stack web frameworks and exposure to more recent technologies. You have theoretical foundations as well as practical experience designing and implementing distributed systems. You should have a real passion for and experience of Agile working practices like Scrum, with a strong desire to work with baked-in quality disciplines such as TDD, BDD, test automation and DevOps principles. You have attested ability to work well in delivering complex systems in a fast paced changing environment. You have the ability to develop intuitive and robust user interfaces which improves user experience.  We value these characteristics:  Pragmatism. You have a thorough understanding of, and are highly informed by, the purist approaches. You also have an understanding of what it takes to deliver working software. Completion. Delivery. Shipping working software with high usability to our customers is what matters most. Your biggest thrill from a big new idea comes when you see it working in the real world. Collaboration. Building software is primarily a social activity so you will play well with others. Figuring out the right thing for the team to do is not about winning a debate at all costs. Diversity. You value everyone's ideas, background, thoughts, and culture. Curiosity. You like to learn. You continually, and deliberately, learn. Passion. You are passionate about software. You live and breathe software. It is not just a job, it is a way of life.  Credit Suisse is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.Œæ

RoleResponsibility: Œæ  Primary Responsibilities  Lead a team of dataŒæanalysts and take responsibility for career development, functional development and project management Discovery of insights via the analysis of multiple data sources and advanced analytics, including media insights & commissioned research Review statistical or machine learning models for service delivery Advise on industrialisation of advanced analytics services and assist Innovation Lead with industrialisation as appropriate Oversight of advanced tools, such as NLP, visualisation etc, where some domain knowledge is required and/or programming skills are necessary Ability to set up crawlers for sites and social channels   Secondary Responsibilities  Guides and up-skills junior analysts, including occasional review of their output Identify candidates for new services or ways-of-working improvements and feed this into a global centre of excellence to drive service improvement

Be confident enough in approaches such as machine learning, natural language processing or artificial intelligence that they can confidently explain the uses or interpretation of these to non technical experts.Œæ Comfortable in the digital space. JobTitle: Head (UORM) Risk Control Core Infrastructure Services
RoleResponsibility: We are currently looking for Head (UORM) Risk Control Core Infrastructure Services ŒæJob Overview The Head Risk & Control role (UORM) is responsible for and has oversight over Operational Risk management, control management and audit management across the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) that has been assigned to the role. This role is key and responsible for continuing improvements in the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) approach to risk identification and mitigation, control management and audit engagement within the framework set out by the relevant authorities. This operations role ensures a constant state of preparation, readiness and continuous improvement across process, risk management and reduction, audit success, documentation, MIS systems and reporting Job Purpose  Advise and assist the Technology Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) Head in driving and directing effective compliance with the prescribed operational risk management framework Implement effective and efficient controls to minimise / mitigate operational impact Ensure proper management of risk and timely resolution of issuesŒæ Promote understanding, practice and culture of Operational Risk within the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains.  Key Responsibilities Œæ Risk Reviews  Scope and plan thematic risk / control reviews aligning with the Portfolioäó»s key objectives, Group Internal Audit themes and key risk areas (may include suppliers where appropriate) Provide guidance on scope and plan risk / control reviews of significant new projects Provide guidance to SRMs / RMs (ORMs) on execution of risk / control reviews Monitor material actions and risks arising from the reviews (Unit risk forums/TSRCF)Œæ Provide support and guidance on control design to SRM / RM (ORMs) and Process Owner. Review proposed addition of or change in controls.Œæ Review and agree changes and / or new Control indicators (KCI, KRI, CST etc) with 2nd Line (GOR) Represent the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) as the Single Point of Contact (SPoC) on internal and external audits and Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the audit working practices Ensure that the affected Portfolio i.e. multiple domains (and units within) and SRM / RM (ORMs) are sufficiently prepared for upcoming audits Review adequacy of management response to audit findings Review progress and timely closure of audit findings Share thematic risk & audit findings across Portfolio i.e. multiple domains and units.  Process Risk Analysis (PRA)  Provide support and guidance to SRM / RM (ORMs) and Process Owner for PRAs as needed to support efforts in reviewing process and control effectiveness and risk identification Review and endorse outcomes of PRA and track material actions and risks that arise from it Provide support and guidance on control design to SRM / RM and Process Owner. Review and approve proposed addition of or change in controls Review and agree changes and / or new Control indicators (KCI, KRI, CST etc) with R&C äóñ Function HeadŒæ  Risk Forums  Provide support and guidance to SRM / RM (ORMs) and Process Owner to deliver all risk forums within the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) and operates within the approved Terms of Reference (ToR), including membership, agenda, frequency.etc. Facilitation of and pack production for the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) risk forums. Provide challenge to ensure robust Risk Management practice Provide governance support to the RM / SRM at the unit risk forums Submission of risk and control related details to Technology Services Risk Forum (TSRCF), within schedule and at the required quality. To be approved by R&C äóñ Function HeadŒæ  Management Information  Ensure that management (and any other stakeholder as required) is kept aware of the risk, control & audit profile of the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains through periodical reportingŒæ Ensure that all management information is produced in line with the defined schedule and quality and should support management decision and action Ensure integrity of source and the processing of data to deliver accurate representation in management informationŒæ  Validation of Controls: (KCI, KRI, CST,)  Review trend analysis of exceptions and identify systemic failures Identify material exceptions and escalateŒæ  Issue Management (records in TRMF, EORP & Riskwise)  Review and endorse new and changed records (including treatment plans and risk ratings) Oversight of completeness and integrity of data Review the issue closure pack prepared by ORMäó»s and provide for Group Internal Audit for cases cutting across multiple domains Œæ(where appropriate)Œæ  People ManagementŒæ  Manage both the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) operational delivery for medium and high risks areas, as well as matrix people management aspects of SRM / RM (ORMs) within the team and domains  Change ManagementŒæ  Drive implementation and adoption of agreed initiatives across the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains including training, communication and awareness.  Key Relationships  Portfolio i.e. multiple domains Heads and Process Owners, SRM / RM (ORMs) within and outside of the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains in the management of controls, Peer Risk & Control Portfolio Leads in other Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) Œæin managing cross multiple domains operational risks and sharing of best practices 2nd line Operational Risk and Risk & Control for advice and guidance and steering with regards to group initiatives Group Operational Risk (GOR) for interpretation and effective implementation of its Policy and Procedures TS Operational Risk Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) in-country, GSSCs, WB Operations and CB Operations on relevant technology risk and controls Legal & Compliance for interpretation of and consultations on regulatory requirements Process Governance team for process and control metrics Group Internal Audit (GIA) and external auditors on audit and reviews.  Key Measurable  Effectiveness of the controls and monitoring of operational risks and controls at the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains operational level Satisfactory results on audits undertaken by Group Internal Audit, FSA, regulators and external auditors Timely reporting and escalation of all operational risk exposures and control failures Timely communication of changes to Policies, control environment and regulatory environment from Legal & Compliance and GOR Monitoring and adherence to timelines on Risk & Control or Group initiatives Cross team collaboration and leadership skills äóñ proactive engagement with stakeholders Succession planning for Risk Manager & Risk Controllers roles  Authorities  Free access to Portfolio i.e. multiple domains Head, Line Managers, peer Risk Controllers / Risk Managers and Process Governance team Free access to all documents and records within the purview of the Portfolio i.e. multiple domains Head and for area of responsibility, with the exception of information governed by specific policies, e.g. Chinese Walls Free access to all meetings under jurisdiction Recommend and implement actions and solutions to mitigate operational risks and enhance compliance at the Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) operational level.
Requirements: Experience and Skills  Overall 10+ years of overall work experience At least 5 years experience in Operational Risk within technology At least 10 years experience in any (combination of) technology discipline An in-depth understanding of controls required to manage Technology Risk and preferable experience with tools that have been used in the industry to do so An understanding of Technology Infrastructure / Applications / Project Lifecycle and the associated controls required through project delivery to manage and mitigate risk Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognising, anticipating, and resolving operational or process problems Confident and self-motivated leader with experience in effectively negotiating with and influencing others in a matrix environment Ability and confidence to operate across a wide range of seniority levels, Portfolio (i.e. multiple domains) operational divides, locations and businessesŒæ Be able to create and tailor clear and concise verbal and written communications to different audiences, fluent written and spoken English language skills Possess a pro-active posture and committed to continuous improvement Good presentation skills Demonstrable analytical thinking Data analysis and reporting skills A team player who enjoys working with people on all levels as well as being able to work independently and under pressure to meet tight deadlines.Œæ  The following skills are not a pre-requisites, but will be advantageous:  Practical experience in engaging / managing technology audit engagement or being a member of a technology audit team Experience in implementing ITIL or COBIT Organizational Change Management experience. Plan for and overcome the issues encountered with change, deliver sustainable change Project management experience / background, ideally with distributed teams Experience in any other risk management discipline (Credit, Market..etc) Experience working in an financial institution industry  Qualifications  Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business Administration or Commerce ITIL Foundation certified Certification in CRISC (Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control certification), Certification in CISA (Certified Information System Auditor) or any other related qualification would be beneficial Any COBIT related certification would be beneficial 	Œæ  How to Apply Click here ( https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/jobdetail.ftl?job=1700002405&lang=en ) to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential You can search and view current opportunities across our organization and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com and selecting Careers. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

RoleResponsibility: As a result of ongoing and continued successes both within Singapore and internationally, this global pharmaceuticals industry leader within the consumer world is recruiting an IT Business Analyst (Contract) to join the digital division. This job will be based in Singapore. About the IT Business Analyst (Contract) Role:  You will be working with the data team and helping to gather requirements to build a Sales BI system for reporting purposes across APAC. You will also be tasked to ensure Master Data process is set-up with governance and generating the right KPIs and reporting mechanism. Key Responsibilities:  Analyse, define, and document detailed business and functional requirements for IT projects of medium/large scope and complexity Understand the business process and challenges related to the areas within the business application scope; use that knowledge to communicate functional requirements to the technical team Help define the business case in terms of identifying the key success factors, current issues and potential solutions Assist the business in analysing functional impacts of project, processing business organisation and communicating benefits and risks Travel across APAC region to gather requirements and conduct user interviews if required
Requirements: To succeed in the IT Business Analyst (Contract) role, you will need a good understanding of the commercial sales operation models in an FMCG company and have strong organisational skills and excellent client-facing and internal communication skills. Key Requirements:  At least five years' work experience as a Business Analyst Experience with commercial sales systems such as ERP (SAP, JDE), CRM (Sales force and forecasting systems) Understand route-to-market for consumer products from primary, secondary and point-of-sales operation models Ability to conduct business analysis on a distributed global matrix environment Ability to manage and provide solutions for businesses and technology stakeholders across various levels to propose product road maps for distributor information systems Competent in the use of Agile, DevOps models and able to define user stories for product development Experience working with big data analytics, data integration and Microsoft Power BI or equivalent analytics tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills  The successful IT Business Analyst (Contract) will join an FMCG company whose expertise has made them the leader in their field. This well-recognised and dynamic brand offers a great working environment. If you have a successful track record of gathering requirements for a systems implementations project, you can take your career forward with this exciting IT Business Analyst (Contract) role.  Apply now or call me to discuss this new opportunity. Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451 EA Registration No.: R1872856 Geraldine Lee
